Key Match Events: The Twins were done in by a blowup inning on Tuesday night, as Jhoan Duran surrendered four runs in the 10th inning and a second Twins rally came up shy as the Atlanta Braves held on for an 8-6 victory in extra innings.
Pre-Game Insights: Royce Lewis is working out at second base to prepare for game action if he's ever needed, but he's yet to discover a comfort zone at the position.
Post-Match Reflections: Ryan Jeffers said it'sucks' to lose, and the team knows they've got to continue to do more. Manager Rocco Baldelli said they battled back, but they know they've got to play complete baseball games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins added pitchers Caleb Boushley and Michael Tonkin, and designated Trevor Richards for assignment. Joe Ryan's regular season officially ended on Tuesday, but he's working to stay focused in case he's needed for the playoffs.
Others: The Twins have lost seven of their last nine games, and the season is coming to an end with a month left. The team's success with Willi Castro has led manager Rocco Baldelli to move Lewis around and see the field from different angles.
